name: 陳維昌
objective: Orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) and multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) techniques are popular transmission techniques for wireless and mobile communications, because they offer several advantages such as increasing transmission data rate and enhancing error performance. In the class, we will learn about the basic principles and some advanced topics of OFDM and MIMO. All students taking this class have to study a special topic on OFDM or MIMO as a final project. Some parts of this course will be offered in English.
schedule:
Week 01. Review of communication systems
Week 02. Adjusted holiday
Week 03. Reviews of probability and random process theories
Week 04. Review of detection theory
Week 05. Review of estimation theory
Week 06. OFDM: Orthogonality and efficient implementation by using IFFT/FFT
Week 07. Qingming Festival
Week 08. OFDM: Equivalent discrete-time multipath channel model and equalization for CP-OFDM
Week 09. Midterm Exam 
Week 10. OFDM: Equalization for CP-OFDM and ZP-OFDM
Week 11. OFDM: SC-FDE, DFT-S-OFDM, OFDMA and power allocation problem
Week 12. OFDM: PAPR problem and PAPR reduction techniques
Week 13. OFDM: Large OOB emission problem and OOB emission reduction techniques
Week 14. MIMO: Spatial multiplexing and spatial modulation
Week 15. MIMO: Spatial diversity
Week 16. Duanwu Festival
Week 17. Final Exam
Week 18. Student Oral Presentation

The schedule may be adjusted if necessary.
scorePolicy:
Midterm Exam         30%
Final Exam           30%
Special Topic Report 40% (20% for Oral Presentation and 20% for Paper Report)
